html: (2 Nephi 15:11)."Woe unto them that rise up early [to consume] strong drink." This second woe condemns drunkenness and riotous living. Wise Solomon said it well when he stated, "Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? … They that tarry long at the wine." (Proverbs 23:29-30.) This woe is not confined to drunks, but is an indictment of all who insatiably pursue raucous and riotous living. They pursue pleasure ("in their feasts") from "early in the morning … until night … but they regard not the work of the Lord."
